dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Forbes just reported that Lilium is now valued at a staggering $5.3 billion after this SPAC merger—does that number feel real to you, or does it scream bubble?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Forbes just reported that Lilium is now valued at a staggering five point three dollars billion after this S P A C merger-does that number feel real to you, or does it scream bubble?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium will list on the Nasdaq through a reverse merger with former General Motors executive Barry Engles blank-check company Qell Acquisition Corp at a $3.3 billion valuation.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, it's definitely ambitious, especially considering they're shifting to a new five-seat hydrogen aircraft. But that $730 million in fresh capital gives them serious runway.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, it's definitely ambitious, especially considering they're shifting to a new five-seat hydrogen aircraft. But that seven hundred thirty dollars million in fresh capital gives them serious runway.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Munich-based startup will raise $830 million through the deal with $380 million from Engles SPAC, and $450 million in private investments in public equity to fuel its bet small electric aircraft can beat the traffic on congested city roads.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Right, and they're aiming for commercial operations by 2025—that feels aggressive, doesn't it? Like, they haven't even started flight testing the smaller model until next year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, and they're aiming for commercial operations by twenty twenty five-that feels aggressive, doesn't it? Like, they haven't even started flight testing the smaller model until next year.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium said the funds would be used to fund the development and testing of a new seven seat electric aircraft and the launch of commercial operations in 2024.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, exactly. And they lost their unicorn status not long ago after a funding round, so this sudden valuation jump is… uh, quite a turnaround.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, exactly. And they lost their unicorn status not long ago after a funding round, so this sudden valuation jump is... uh, quite a turnaround.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium itself joined Europes unicorn club of startups with a $1 billion valuation following a $35 million round from high-profile tech investors Baillie Gifford in June.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Plus, they're up against some heavy competition. Joby's sitting on $2.6 billion, Volocopter just raised hundreds of millions… the air taxi space is getting crowded.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Plus, they're up against some heavy competition. Joby's sitting on two point six dollars billion, Volocopter just raised hundreds of millions... the air taxi space is getting crowded.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Joby raised $1.6 billion in its own reverse merger with a blank-check company in February that valued the California-based business at $6.6 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: But Lilium's betting big on hydrogen, not batteries. Daniel Wiegand from Joby even mentioned it's key for lower emissions and noise—do you buy that advantage?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But Lilium's betting big on hydrogen, not batteries. Daniel Wiegand from Joby even mentioned it's key for lower emissions and noise-do you buy that advantage?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Today's announcement brings us closer to launching our passenger service, said Daniel Wiegand, co-founder and CEO, Lilium in a statement.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: I mean, in theory, yeah, hydrogen could be a game-changer for clean transport, but the infrastructure? Building vertiports with partners like Iberdrola… that's a huge hurdle.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: I mean, in theory, yeah, hydrogen could be a game-changer for clean transport, but the infrastructure? Building vertiports with partners like Iberdrola... that's a huge hurdle.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium announced plans in January to develop a network of vertiports across Florida with Spanish infrastructure company Ferrovial, which is the owner of Londons Heathrow Airport, and revealed today that it was in talks for a similar network of shuttle landing pads in Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: And they're already looking at South America for landing networks? That feels like they're spreading themselves pretty thin before even proving the tech.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And they're already looking at South America for landing networks? That feels like they're spreading themselves pretty thin before even proving the tech.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium announced plans in January to develop a network of vertiports across Florida with Spanish infrastructure company Ferrovial, which is the owner of Londons Heathrow Airport, and revealed today that it was in talks for a similar network of shuttle landing pads in Europe.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. I wonder if investors are just chasing the next big thing after seeing what happened with other SPAC deals earlier this year.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. I wonder if investors are just chasing the next big thing after seeing what happened with other S P A C deals earlier this year.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostB
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. But hey, um, if they pull it off? Beating city traffic with quiet, emission-free flights… that would be huge.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. But hey, um, if they pull it off? Beating city traffic with quiet, emission-free flights... that would be huge.

dialogue_turns.speaker: HostA
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely massive. Still, that 2025 launch date—I'll believe it when I see it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely massive. Still, that twenty twenty five launch date-I'll believe it when I see it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Lilium said the funds would be used to fund the development and testing of a new seven seat electric aircraft and the launch of commercial operations in 2024.

artist_script:
Forbes just reported that Lilium is now valued at a staggering $5.3 billion after this SPAC merger—does that number feel real to you, or does it scream bubble?
HostB: Oh, it's definitely ambitious, especially considering they're shifting to a new five-seat hydrogen aircraft. But that $730 million in fresh capital gives them serious runway.
HostA: Right, and they’re aiming for commercial operations by 2025—that feels aggressive, doesn't it? Like, they haven't even started flight testing the smaller model until next year.
HostB: Yeah, exactly. And they lost their unicorn status not long ago after a funding round, so this sudden valuation jump is… uh, quite a turnaround.
HostA: Plus, they’re up against some heavy competition. Joby’s sitting on $2.6 billion, Volocopter just raised hundreds of millions… the air taxi space is getting crowded.
HostB: But Lilium’s betting big on hydrogen, not batteries. Daniel Wiegand from Joby even mentioned it’s key for lower emissions and noise—do you buy that advantage?
HostA: I mean, in theory, yeah, hydrogen could be a game-changer for clean transport, but the infrastructure? Building vertiports with partners like Iberdrola… that’s a huge hurdle.
HostB: And they’re already looking at South America for landing networks? That feels like they’re spreading themselves pretty thin before even proving the tech.
HostA: Totally. I wonder if investors are just chasing the next big thing after seeing what happened with other SPAC deals earlier this year.
HostB: For sure. But hey, um, if they pull it off? Beating city traffic with quiet, emission-free flights… that would be huge.
HostA: Absolutely massive. Still, that 2025 launch date—I’ll believe it when I see it.
